Alors qu'elle ne fut pas ma d√©ception d√©but mai, quand j'ai enfin re√ßu ma paire, de voir que celles-ci n'√©taient pas √† ma taille. Je contacte donc le service client qui me donne de quoi renvoyer la paire, ce que je fais pour en faire un √©change.... je l'envoie et attends environ deux semaines. Quand je reprends contacte pour savoir o√π en sont les d√©marches ... on me r√©pond que mes CAPRA montrent des signes d'usures comme si je les avais porter et que par cons√©quent, l'√©change ne serait pas possible pour une paire en 41 et qu'ils allaient me renvoyer la paire en 40. Je conteste et demande donc des preuves de ce qu'ils avancent parce que ce n'est tout simplement pas possible. A ce moment, on me pr√©sente des excuses car l'expert aurait fait une "erreur". Oui, une erreur qui a bien failli me couter plus de 135 euros si je n'avais pas demander de preuves ??? Mais bon, je passe outre. Ils se sont tromp√©s dans le bordereau d'envoi qu'ils m'ont transmis et ils n'ont jamais re√ßu la paire. Encore une fois, j'ai failli m'assoir sur une paire √† plus de 135 euros. On m'envoie donc la paire en 42 que je re√ßois le 17 juin... Soit environ 3 mois apr√®s plus d'une trentaine de mails. MAIS, bien qu'elles m'aillent enfin en terme de pointure, la paire a une semelle t√¢ch√©e d'une grosse trace noir. SUPER. N'en pouvant plus de passer mon temps √† envoyer des mails et faire des allers retour √† la poste et aux points relais... j'ai d√©cid√© de les garder. Aujourd'hui, nous sommes le 29 juillet 2025, je les porte r√©guli√®rement. Ce ne sont pas les chaussures les plus confortables que j'ai pu porter. Au moins, elles sont jolies. Par contre, j'ai l'impression qu'elles attrapent toutes les poussi√®res qui peuvent trainer et se salissent vraiment super vite m√™me quand vous ne marcher pas dans des zones sales... En conclusion : Un d√©lais √† rallonge pour obtenir les chaussures qui selon moi ne valent pas leur prix. Je les acheter 135 euros. Mtn elles sont √† 150 donc elles ne les valent encore moins. Des chaussures fabriqu√©es en chine et non pas en europe alors que la marque insiste sur leur production europ√©enne. N√©anmoins je tiens quand m√™me √† remercier C√©cile avec qui j'ai communiqu√© tout au long de ces mois et qui a essay√© d'arranger les situations. J'esp√®re que mon exp√©rience vous servira. title: Arnaque ! √Ä fuir
text: Arnaque, faites attention. Le jour du Salon de l'alliance √† Paris. Ils nous ont gentiment propos√© des bagues factices le temps d'envoyer nos vrais bagues car le d√©lai serait peut √™tre trop long. (Nous sommes debut Mai) Jusqu'ici tout va bien. Nous arrivons une semaine avant le mariage (d√©but Juin), nous nous disons "√ßa ne viendra pas √† temps mais c'est pas grave nous avons les factices". Mi-Juillet, nous d√©cidons d'appeler parce que √ßa commence √† faire long (2 mois d'attente). Ils nous parlent comme ci c'est nous qui avons tort "Bah Monsieur il faut nous envoyer les factices, sinon on vous envoie pas les bagues". Alors que de base ils √©taient sens√© nous envoyer les bagues avant le mariage (qui √©tait en Juin) et par la suite nous aurions retourn√© les factices. Ils parlent avec hauteur et d√©sobligeance, alors que nous avons √©puis√© plus de 10k pour les 2 bagues chez eux et tout ce qu'ils trouvent √† dire √† leurs clients c'est "c'est de votre faute". Mais elle n'est pas l√† l'arnaque... Nous avons donc renvoyer les factices avec le bon de retour. Ils disent, je cite : "Nous accusons bonne r√©ception du retour des alliances factices, toutefois celles-ci sont malheureusement en tr√®s mauvais √©tat. [...] elles ne sont plus r√©utilisables. [...] en cas de d√©t√©rioration des alliances, un montant de 119 euros par alliance endommag√©e vous serait factur√©. J'ai dis "Ok si elles ne sont plus r√©utilisable, du coup renvoyez les nous, plus nos vrais bagues". Ils ont refus√© sans vraiment donner une raison tangible. Bref... √âvidemment nous avons pay√© les 236‚Ç¨ pour payer leurs fausses bagues "inutilisable" afin de ENFIN (apr√®s presque 3 mois d'attente) recevoir nos vrais bagues. S'ils vous proposent des bagues factices, RE-FU-SEZ ! Si vous avez une 2√®me option, n'allez pas chez eux. Qui plus est, ils sont hors de prix et baisse de 5 ou 600‚Ç¨ puis vous regarde comme si vous faites l'affaire du si√®cle. Mais je comprend, c'est le business. Ils profitent des heureux mari√©s qui veulent faire plaisir, et qui sont en position de faiblesse. √Ä fuir !

title: Any Boutique that still using fur will‚Ä¶

They claim it was a final sale but there is no mention of that on my order. Very bad experience. I hope they have made a mistake and will reconsider. If not, I will not do business with them again.

title: Submit a formal complaint
text: I came to AF because of a purchase I made from Neiman Marcus.  I came to the online store hoping to find another staple blouse to add to my wardrobe. I also believed AF maintained similar business practices. Sadly, I have had a similarly poor experience with Anne Fontaine regarding a partial refund that I‚Äôve not received, 6 weeks after the return as well as their business practice regarding the refund policy. Please submit a complaint to the NY Attorney General‚Äôs Office. ag.ny.gov file-complaint You can also submit a separate complaint in your home state, if outside of NY.

title: Refund issue
text: If the product you ordered does not work, the refund is over 3 weeks since your returned product was received and credit. Still waiting after 3 weeks. Not good practice in my opinion.

title: BEWARE!!!!
text: I suppose I should have looked at all of the negative reviews first. Let me start at the beginning. I had never set foot into an Anne Fontaine Boutique prior to this experience. I had been invited to a Galentine's event in the store, that transpired on Feb. 9th...the event itself by the PR company they hired, was adorable.... I wanted so badly to love this shop, but it's no surprise that they needed help getting people to come in and shop, as their customer service is lacking so terribly. I was hesitant to shop as I had promised my boyfriend I would pause on shopping and make better investment choices this year, but there was an absolutely beautiful outfit that I just loved. Before I made the purchase, my boyfriend rushed me out of there so I could keep my promise.... So quickly that I accidentally left my coat behind. So after we had dinner, I ran back in to get my coat and was coaxed into purchasing the outfit I had tried on (honestly it didn't take too much coaxing, as I really did LOVE the outfit) since I had left my purse in the car, I told the sales associate to secretly text me so I could purchase the outfit on the sly, and rushed back out. Moment of weakness on my part and I definitely shouldn't have broken my promise. But via text, I made the purchase that evening. Alan was so helpful, and such a sweetheart, it made the transaction so smooth! I was told I could swing by to pick up my purchase any time. Well come Valentine's Day, I still had not picked up my purchase and the guilt was settling in... I fessed up to my boyfriend and it didn't go to well... I knew I messed up and needed to make it right by canceling the transaction, so on the 22nd I texted Alan and explained what had happened (remember, he knew I was being sneaky when I made the purchase) and he asked if he could call me, when we spoke he informed me that they do not accept returns and only do store credit. I was horrified. I begged, I never even picked up the items, the website says the return window is 14 days and the cold response I received could've given me frost bite. Where was the kindness from before? I asked if I could speak with the manager, he said she would just tell me the same thing, but I asked if she could call me anyways. I waited, but received no call. So I then call corporate, the associate on the phone was so lovely and kept apologizing, she said she would get this taken care of immediately and they can absolutely refund me, she submitted a form to request the refund and a call from the manager. Soon after, the manager, Daisy, calls me and says that she cannot do a refund, in fact, I should've seen the sign at the register that claims there are no refunds... I remind her that my transaction took place over the phone... to which she responds saying that the store doesn't even have the capability of doing a refund. I ask who I can speak with to get a refund and she says the concierge I spoke with previously would be the ones who could do it. Sending me in circles. Soon after, Alan sends me a text, and things just get worse. He starts off stating that "per my request" they were giving me store credit. No. No I definitely did not request store credit. Then he pretends as if he made me aware of the policy stating there are no returns, claiming he tells EVERY new customer and that he has witnesses. I tell him, I'm not upset with him, I explain it's ok, we are all human, but he did not tell me this, I'm sure at the register he does remember to say this, even if just out of habit, but not once in any of this did he tell me there are no refunds. I remind him that The items never left the store. This has been an awful experience and I plead that he not make this worse, I mean, come on... you have witnesses? How hostile and guilty do you really feel where you have to attack the customer?!! Truly, I can say, I have never experienced such immature, egotistical behavior at ANY supposed luxury brand boutique in my life. The purchase was not made in store, it was all made via text.customer service is the foundation of a successful business and I know when I walk into Chanel, Hermes, Saks, Neimans and Nordstroms that they go above and beyond to ensure I come back to shop again. Unfortunately, I do not feel that way about Anne Fontaine, in fact I've been made to feel that in the event that any future purchase would be a terrible mistake as if I have any problems, I'll be met with a lack of genuine compassion or care. I can see why Anne Fontaines boutique needed help getting people to come in and shop if this is how customers are treated, it's so unfortunate and unnecessary, and it would not surprise me if this location shuts down with how it's being ran. Overall, definitely not worth the prices, the clothing may be beautiful, but how customers are treated reveals everything

title: Poor Quality leather jacket
text: Purchased a Loryna jacket from Anne Fontaine for 1350 euros. I‚Äôd tried it in the store in Paris with the help of the sales assistant and it was just right. I hadn‚Äôt even removed the labels yet but when I went to put it on last week the left rear shoulder ripped. I called Anne Fontaine Bond Street regarding the poor quality issue. Luisa the manager asked me to bring it in. As she wasn‚Äôt there when I went I left the jacket for her to inspect. She then asked me to pop in to discuss the matter before she went on holiday. I went in yesterday and to my horror she was so rude and accused me of damaging the jacket stating that it was not a quality issue. I told her that I hadn‚Äôt even removed the labels yet and had put it on for the first time since returning from France. She did not want to listen and continued to accuse me of putting it on incorrectly. I used to be a loyal customer of this brand but it seems recently that their quality has deteriorated and their customer service is non existent. It has now become overpriced cheap quality fashion. The labels don‚Äôt even state where it‚Äôs made. Pics available but don‚Äôt know how to upload them here.
